# Decree No. 76 of 2025
## Regarding the Renewal of the Appointment of the Head of His Highness the Prime Minister's Diwan

- Having reviewed the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>,
- And Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Law No. 15 of 1979 regarding Civil Service <orig>الخدمة المدنية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And Decree-Law No. 48 of 1979 regarding the determination of salaries for the Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and Ministers <orig>الوزراء</orig>,
- And the Decree issued on 7 Jumada al-Ula 1399 AH corresponding to 4 April 1979 AD regarding the Civil Service System <orig>نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And Decree No. 122 of 2021 appointing the Head of His Highness the Prime Minister's Diwan <orig>رئيس ديوان سمو رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
We have decreed the following:

### Article One
The appointment of / Abdulaziz Dakheel Al-Dakheel <orig>عبد العزيز دخيل الدخيل</orig> - Head of His Highness the Prime Minister's Diwan <orig>رئيس ديوان سمو رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> - with the rank of Minister <orig>بدرجة وزير</orig> - is renewed for a period of four years, effective from 11/5/2025.

### Article Two
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> shall implement this Decree, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Issued at Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف</orig> on: 29 Shawwal 1446 AH
Corresponding to: 27 April 2025 AD

# Decree No. 78 of 2025
### Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship from Certain Individuals

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Amiri Decree <orig>المرسوم الأميري</orig> No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law <orig>قانون الجنسية الكويتية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية بالنيابة</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:

**Article One**
Kuwaiti citizenship shall be withdrawn from the individuals listed below, and from anyone who may have acquired it through them by dependency:
1- Turki Ashwan Kardoush Al-Enezi <orig>تركي عشوان كردوش العنزي</orig>.
2- Munira Mohammed Arshid <orig>منيرة محمد ارشيد</orig>.

**Article Two**
The Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية</orig> shall implement this Decree, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Council of Ministers' Decision <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## No. 493 of 2025
### Amending Council of Ministers' Decision <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء</orig>
### No. 207/First of 2025
### On the Establishment of the Committee for Special Organizations
### for the Withdrawal and Revocation of Kuwaiti Nationality <orig>الجنسية الكويتية</orig>

The Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Amiri Decree <orig>المرسوم الأميري</orig> No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law <orig>قانون الجنسية الكويتية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And the Decree issued on 7 Jumada al-Ula 1399 AH corresponding to 4 April 1979 AD concerning the Civil Service System <orig>نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig> and its amending decrees,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And Council of Ministers' Decision <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء</orig> No. (207/First of 2025) on the establishment of the Committee for Special Organizations for the Withdrawal and Revocation of Kuwaiti Nationality <orig>الجنسية الكويتية</orig>,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Interior <orig>وزير الداخلية بالنيابة</orig>,
Has decided:

### Article One
The texts of Articles (First, paragraph one, and Second) of the aforementioned Council of Ministers' Decision <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء</orig> No. 207/First of 2025 shall be replaced with the following texts:
Article (First, paragraph one):
((A committee shall be established to consider grievances related to the withdrawal, revocation, and loss of Kuwaiti nationality <orig>الجنسية الكويتية</orig>, and it shall be affiliated with the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>)).

### Article Two:
((The committee shall be responsible for receiving, considering, examining, studying, and preparing necessary recommendations regarding grievances submitted by those whose Kuwaiti nationality <orig>الجنسية الكويتية</orig> has been withdrawn, revoked, or lost, or from whom the nationality certificate <orig>شهادة الجنسية</orig> has been withdrawn, and for submitting proposals within the framework of applicable laws, regulations, and decisions)).

### Article Three:
All concerned authorities <orig>الجهات المعنية</orig> shall implement this decision, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Acting Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء بالنيابة</orig>
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Decided

After reviewing:
- Decree-Law No. (68) of 1980 issuing the Commercial Law <orig>قانون التجارة</orig> and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (32) of 1982 regarding the Civil Information System <orig>نظام المعلومات المدنية</orig>,
- And Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning Labor in the Private Sector <orig>العمل في القطاع الأهلي</orig> and its amending laws,
- And Law No. 109 of 2013 concerning the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>,
- And Law No. 111 of 2013 concerning Commercial Shop Licenses <orig>تراخيص المحلات التجارية</orig>,
- And Law No. 1 of 2016 issuing the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and its amending laws,
- And Law No. 33 of 2016 regarding Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, amended by Law No. 1 of 2018,
- And Decree No. (191) of 2015 regarding the Organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>,
- And Decree No. (73) of 2024 forming the Cabinet <orig>تشكيل الوزارة</orig> and its amending decrees,
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (411) of 2013 on the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> for Law No. 111 of 2013 concerning Commercial Shop Licenses <orig>تراخيص المحلات التجارية</orig> and its amending resolutions,
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (287) of 2016 issuing the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> for Law No. 1 of 2016 issuing the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and its amending resolutions,
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (209) of 2017 regarding the Regulation of the Establishment of Partnership Companies <orig>شركات الأشخاص</orig>,
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (161) of 2016 regarding the Establishment and Competencies of the One-Stop Shop Department <orig>إدارة النافذة الواحدة</orig>,
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (1358) of 2018 on the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> for Law No. (33) of 2016 regarding Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>,
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (146) of 2023 regarding the Permissibility of Unifying the Headquarters for a Company and its Subsidiaries <orig>توحيد المقر للشركة والشركات التابعة لها</orig>,
- And based on what was presented by the Undersecretary of the Ministry,

### Article One
For the purpose of applying the provisions of this Resolution, the following terms shall have the meanings assigned to each of them:
*   **Employer**: Any natural or legal person who employs workers for a wage.
*   **Automated Number / Al-Raqm Al-Aali <orig>الرقم الآلي</orig>**: A unique, non-repeating 8-digit number assigned to each unit across the State of Kuwait to facilitate identifying the unit's location and retrieving its detailed data.
*   **Civil ID Number for the Entity / Al-Raqm Al-Madani Lil-Jiha <orig>الرقم المدني للجهة</orig>**: A unique, non-repeating 11-digit number assigned to each entity across the State of Kuwait to facilitate identifying the entity's data.
*   **Commercial Unit / Al-Wahda Al-Tijariya <orig>الوحدة التجارية</orig>**: A space limited by a specific area, subject to increase or decrease, allowing the practice of any branch of commercial activities as required by the laws and regulations governing commercial licenses in the State of Kuwait.
*   **Unified Headquarters / Al-Maqar Al-Muwahhad <orig>المقر الموحد</orig>**: A single commercial unit bearing more than one civil ID number, used as a shared location for conducting commercial activities by a main company and its subsidiaries, or its branches, or single-person companies, provided that the regulatory controls and requirements approved by the competent authorities are met, and that the number of licenses used for the headquarters does not exceed five licenses.

### Article Two
Any natural or legal person who owns more than 50% in subsidiaries, their branches, single-person companies, or similar entities, has the right to use a single headquarters and more than one automated number for the same unit, provided that the number of licenses does not exceed five.

### Article Three
The concerned person must submit an application to the Ministry through the One-Stop Shop Department <orig>إدارة النافذة الواحدة</orig>, accompanied by the lease contract and the payment receipt including the name of the main natural or legal person.

### Article Four
Companies and natural and legal persons covered by the provisions of this Resolution must obtain the approval of Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> for the commercial unit.

<header>
8 Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1737 Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 6 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1446 AH – 4 / 5 / 2025 AD
</header>

The decision comes in response to the reality of some commercial activities that do not require a physical headquarters to conduct their operations, yet were previously obligated to rent locations solely for obtaining commercial activity licenses. This constituted an unjustified financial burden, especially during the foundational stages of projects. The decision addresses this issue by providing flexible solutions that reduce costs and alleviate burdens on investors, without compromising regulatory and oversight requirements.
The decision also enhances the effectiveness of government oversight over licensed commercial activities by centralizing addresses and unifying locations associated with a number of licenses. This facilitates regulatory bodies, primarily the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> and the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, in carrying out their tasks of inspection, follow-up, and ensuring the compliance of beneficiaries with actually licensed activities, without the need to distribute oversight efforts across scattered locations. This regulation contributes to achieving a higher degree of discipline and administrative traceability within the business environment.
The decision also grants the competent authorities, primarily the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> and Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, powers to review applications and verify the fulfillment of necessary requirements. Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> has been tasked with verifying the conformity of the classification of properties used as unified headquarters with the nature of the licensed activities, in accordance with approved urban planning requirements. Similarly, the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> reviews the applicant's request, ensures compliance with the requirements, and then issues separate civil identification numbers for the unit, with a maximum of five numbers for each licensed entity within the unified headquarters, in accordance with the lease agreement data.
This decision replaces Ministerial Decision No. (146) of 2023 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم (146) لسنة 2023</orig>, following a comprehensive re-evaluation aimed at expanding the scope of benefit and simplifying procedures, while taking into account applicable laws and procedures.
This decision represents one of multiple stages within a broader strategy adopted by the Ministry, aimed at regulating the labor market, improving performance efficiency, and reducing operational burdens. Should the decision's implementation prove successful and its positive impact be measured, the Ministry will study the possibility of expanding its scope of benefit in the future to include additional activities and allow for the unification of headquarters even in cases where the ownership percentage is less than 50%, according to clear and well-studied criteria that ensure a balance between facilitation and oversight.
With this integrated regulation, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> affirms its commitment to empowering investors and creating a flexible and stimulating business environment that enhances the competitiveness and sustainability of the business sector in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.

required for use as a unified headquarters in accordance with the building regulations issued in this regard before the approval of headquarters unification.

## Article Five
The Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig> shall issue separate civil identification numbers, with a maximum of five numbers for each entity within the unified headquarters, in accordance with the approved lease agreement data.

## Article Six
The terms and controls set by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> regarding the estimation of labor needs shall be observed.

## Article Seven
All other conditions and requirements determined by the Ministry and the relevant official authorities must be fulfilled.

## Article Eight
Ministerial Decision No. (146) of 2023 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم (146) لسنة 2023</orig> referred to herein shall be repealed, and any provision that contradicts or violates the provisions of this decision shall also be repealed.

## Article Nine
All concerned parties – each within its jurisdiction – shall implement this decision, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبدالله العجيل</orig>

Within the framework of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry's <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> efforts to enhance the business environment and stimulate investment in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, this Ministerial Decision was issued as a regulatory step aimed at addressing one of the most prominent challenges facing investors and owners of commercial activities, especially small and medium-sized enterprises, related to the requirements of multiple headquarters and their operational costs.
The decision stipulates allowing the use of a unified headquarters and an automated unified address number for no more than five licenses, for natural or legal persons who own influential stakes in subsidiary companies, branches, or single-person companies, provided that these activities are administrative or office-based, and it has been determined

# Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Resolution No. (75) of 2025
Regarding the Delisting of Shares of Jeiad Holding Company <orig>شركة جياد القابضة</orig>
(K.S.C.P.)
from Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت</orig> for Securities

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- And based on Resolution No. (158) of 2024 regarding the suspension of trading of shares of Jeiad Holding Company <orig>شركة جياد القابضة</orig> (K.S.C.P.) listed on Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت</orig> for Securities, issued on 04/12/2024.
- And on the decision of the Board of Commissioners of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> issued at its meeting No. (10) of 2025 held on 23/04/2025 regarding the delisting of shares of Jeiad Holding Company <orig>شركة جياد القابضة</orig> (K.S.C.P.) from Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت</orig> for Securities.
It has been decided as follows:
## Article One
The delisting of shares of Jeiad Holding Company <orig>شركة جياد القابضة</orig> (K.S.C.P.) from Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت</orig> for Securities, in accordance with clauses (7) and (8) of Article 2-4-1 of Book Twelve (Listing Rules) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities and their amendments, due to Jeiad Holding Company's <orig>شركة جياد القابضة</orig> breach and non-compliance with the application of several provisions of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (7) of 2010 and its amendments, specifically the articles of Book Fifteen (Corporate Governance) and the articles of Book Twelve (Listing Rules).
## Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Chairman of the Board of Commissioners of the Capital Markets Authority / Hay'at Aswaq Al-Mal <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>

It was decided as follows:
## Article One
The registration of the auditor, Ms. Hind Abdullah Hamad Al-Saree' <orig>هند عبد الله حمد السريع</orig>, in the special register for auditors with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> shall be renewed for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 10/05/2025.

The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.

# Decision No. (78) of 2025 regarding the renewal of a securities activities license for Hayat Investment Company <orig>شركة حياة للاستثمار</orig>

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments;
- The securities activities license certificate for Hayat Investment Company <orig>شركة حياة للاستثمار</orig> No. (AP/2016/0018) issued on 18/07/2022;
- The request from Hayat Investment Company <orig>شركة حياة للاستثمار</orig> to renew its securities activities license with the Authority;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>, issued on 12/01/2025.

It was decided as follows:
## Article One
The securities activity license for Hayat Investment Company <orig>شركة حياة للاستثمار</orig> with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> shall be renewed to practice the activity of a securities broker not registered on the stock exchange.
This renewal is for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 18/07/2025.

## Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

# Decision No. (79) of 2025
## Regarding
Private Marketing License for a Collective Investment Scheme Established Outside the State of Kuwait Granted to Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> for Marketing Shares of Boubyan Islamic Ijara Fund Company <orig>شركة صندوق بوبيان للإجارة الإسلامي</orig>

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, and its Executive Regulations and their amendments;
- The Articles of Association and Memorandum of Incorporation of Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>, and the agreement concluded between the representative of the Collective Investment Scheme, Ceres Fund Management (Cayman) Limited, and the Marketing Manager, Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>;
- The request from Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to undertake the private marketing of shares of Boubyan Islamic Ijara Fund Company <orig>شركة صندوق بوبيان للإجارة الإسلامي</orig>;
- Based on Decision No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

It has been decided as follows:
## Article One
Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> is licensed to privately market 5 million shares (five million shares only) of Boubyan Islamic Ijara Fund Company (BOUBYAN ISLAMIC IJARA FUND COMPANY) within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, established in the Cayman Islands. The offer price shall be 10 US Dollars (ten US Dollars only) per share, in addition to a subscription commission of 2.25% payable once upon subscription.
## Article Two
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be offered to professional clients only, as per the text in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities and their amendments. The entities receiving subscription requests shall be:
- Boubyan Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بوبيان كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>.
- Boubyan Bank <orig>بنك بوبيان</orig>.
## Article Three
The objectives of the Collective Investment Scheme shall be determined based on what is stated in the prospectus.
## Article Four
The marketing license duration is one year, renewable annually, starting from the date of issuance of the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.
## Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this Decision. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the Decision shall be deemed null and void.
## Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this Decision, each within its respective jurisdiction. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Head of the Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

Issued on: 30 April 2025 AD

## Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>
### Resolution No. (6) of 2025
Regarding Entities that have Regularized their Status
in Accordance with the Law, its Executive Regulations, and their Amendments
Chairman of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>:
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig>, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments,
- And Resolution No. (14) of 2022 regarding applications for issuing licenses to practice insurance activities and insurance professions,
- And based on the decision of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> at its meeting No. (3) of 2025 dated 27/4/2025,
Has decided the following:
### Article One
Entities that have regularized their status, whose details are listed in this Article, are licensed to practice the following activities:

<table_caption>Licensed Entities and Their Activities</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Name of Licensee | Entity Classification | Licensed Activities |
|:--|:---|:---|:---|
| 1 | Safety Insurance Brokerage Company <orig>شركة سيرفتي لوساطة التأمين</orig> | National | Insurance Professions - Insurance Brokerage Activity |
| 2 | Hujoon Insurance Brokerage Company <orig>شركة هوجون لوساطة التأمين</orig> | National | Insurance Professions - Insurance Brokerage Activity |
</table>

The duration of the license to practice the activity shall be (three years), commencing from the date of issuance of this Resolution. The aforementioned entities are obligated to pay the prescribed fees for granting them the practice license, or upon its renewal for any other period, in accordance with Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig>, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments, and the resolutions and circulars issued by the Unit in this regard.

### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this Resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Mohammed Sulaiman Al-Otaiqi <orig>محمد سليمان العتيقي</orig>

## Resolution No. (9) of 2025
Regarding the Suspension of Licenses for Practicing Insurance Business Activities
Chairman of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding Insurance Regulation and its Executive Regulations and amendments,
- Law No. (71) of 2020 issuing the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> and its Executive Regulations and amendments,
- And based on Resolution No. (16) of 2022 regarding the suspension of insurance activities for Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig>,
- And based on the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued on 4/3/2024 regarding Application No. (2023/1) (Restructuring) to open restructuring procedures for Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig>,
- And based on the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued on 15/5/2024 regarding Application No. (2023/1) (Restructuring), granting Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> a temporary license to practice insurance business activities,
- And based on Resolution No. (8) of 2024 regarding granting a temporary license to practice insurance business activities,
- And based on the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued on 6/3/2025 regarding Application No. (2023/1) (Restructuring) to ratify the plan of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> and approve the trustee's requests,
- And based on the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issued on 20/3/2025 regarding Application No. (2023/1) (Restructuring), to suspend the license granted to Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig>,
- And based on the decision of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig> at its 3rd meeting of 2025 on 27/4/2025, in implementation of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision.
The following has been decided:
### Article One
The license to practice granted to Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>شركة أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> by virtue of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision issued on 20/3/2025 shall be temporarily suspended until it complies with the settlement of its affairs as stipulated in the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision issued on 6/3/2025.
### Article Two
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of issuance of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision on 20/3/2025, and shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
## Announcement

The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the launch of Practice No. 916/A for the year 2025-2026 concerning the practice of supplying, installing, operating, maintaining, and guaranteeing LED lighting for the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> complex buildings and external layouts, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be purchased from the Ministry of Information's <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> website via the barcode attached to the announcement, starting from Sunday, 4/5/2025, for a fee of (50 K.D.) only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, non-refundable. Bids must be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> in sealed envelopes and must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the bid value (which should be valid throughout the bid's validity period of 90 days). The practice number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside, along with the practitioner's name or any identifying mark. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Monday, 2/6/2025.
- The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Wednesday, 14/5/2025, at 11:00 AM at the office of Mr. / Assistant Undersecretary for Engineering Affairs <orig>الوكيل المساعد للشئون الهندسية</orig> - Media Complex <orig>مجمع الإعلام</orig> - Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig> - Ground Floor, to answer inquiries regarding the practice. Anyone who has purchased the practice documents may attend the meeting in person or be represented. Everything recorded in the meeting minutes shall be considered an integral part of the practice documents and shall be binding on bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their approved responses to all practitioners before the bid closing date.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, 3 copies, with the exception of (the bid form, initial security deposit, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the practitioner's data form).
- The practice is indivisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for practitioners wishing to attend the bid opening session, after coordination with the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> before the scheduled date for the bid opening session.
- A valid National Labor Force Fulfillment Certificate <orig>شهادة استيفاء العمالة الوطنية</orig> issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be submitted with the bid, noting that

# Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>
## Announcement

The Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No. (2 / 2025 - 2026) regarding the development, modernization, maintenance, and warranty of firewall devices at the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> (non-divisible). Specialized companies / establishments in this field are requested to refer to the Equipment and Contracts Department (Contracts and Tenders Section) at the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> – Administrative Building – Third Floor – Zone 5, to obtain the documents for this practice against a fee of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>, payable by K-Net. Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from these fees, provided proof is submitted, bringing with them a copy of the practice announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and the following documents:
Registration receipt with the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig> for the fiscal year (2025 – 2026). Or
1.  A copy of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> license.
2.  A copy of the Commercial Register.
3.  A copy of the Civil ID number for the establishment or company.
4.  A copy of the company's articles of association (if any).
5.  A copy of the valid registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
6.  A copy of the valid registration certificate from the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>.
7.  A copy of the valid registration receipt with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
8.  A copy of the practitioner's authorized signature.
9.  A certificate from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> regarding the national labor percentage.
10. An authorization letter from the company / establishment for the person authorized to purchase the practice documents.

Please note that the preliminary meeting to receive any inquiries will be held on Wednesday, 2025/05/14 at 11:00 AM, and the closing date (last date for submitting bids) is Thursday, 2025/05/22 from 9:00 AM until 1:00 PM. Bids must be submitted accompanied by an initial security deposit in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Diwan of His Highness the Crown Prince <orig>ديوان سمو ولي العهد</orig>, in the amount of (1,490 K.D.) only one thousand four hundred and ninety Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>. The initial security deposit and the bid shall remain valid for (90) days from the date of bid opening. No bids will be accepted without the full security deposit or submitted after the aforementioned deadline.
For inquiries, call 1853333 ext. 4401 – 4415.

Undersecretary for Financial and Equipment Affairs

# Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>
## Announcement

The Higher Purchasing Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء العليا</orig> for tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its oil companies (H.P.C), and based on the request of Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig> (P.I.C) – Internal Purchasing Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء الداخلية</orig> (I.P.C), announces the issuance of Tender No.: MNA/38/2024 regarding Supplying Gusseted Tube FFS Bag Film To PP Plant.

*   This tender is general and indivisible, conditional upon providing initial securities as attached below.
*   Brief description of the tender works: Supplying Gusseted Tube FFS Bag Film To PP Plant – General Tender
*   The tender closing time is at 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 03/06/2025. Bids must be submitted through the unified electronic platform in the oil sector (K-Tendering). No copy of the bid shall be sent to any other party except the aforementioned platform, otherwise, the bid will be considered void. The bid validity period shall be (90) days from the date of opening the bids, and no bids will be accepted after the specified deadline.
*   The preliminary meeting is scheduled for 10:00 AM on Tuesday, 20/05/2025, noting that the meeting will be held virtually (Virtual Meeting).
*   An initial security deposit in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>, for the amount of (15,000/-) fifteen thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, with the same validity period as the bid. The original initial security must be submitted sufficiently before the closing date, provided that a soft copy is attached with the bid.
*   The original initial bank guarantee, whose value is stated in this announcement, must be submitted to the Sub-Committee for Opening Bids <orig>اللجنة الفرعية لفض مظاريف العطاءات</orig> before the specified tender closing date, at the company's main headquarters in South Al-Sabahiya <orig>جنوب الصباحية</orig>, Office No. (CG-112), with the necessity of attaching a soft copy with the bid.
*   The last date for submitting any inquiries, reservations, or requests by participating companies regarding this tender is 22/05/2025. These requests will not be considered for any reason after this specified deadline.
*   The document purchase value is an amount of (500) five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
*   Documents can be purchased by bank deposit into the account of Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>, with the necessity of clearly stating the aforementioned tender number and the name of the purchasing company on the following receipt:

Qualification Conditions for Tendering for the Supply of Gusseted Tube FFS Bag Film Rolls for Polypropylene Product Packaging
1- The supplier must have experience in supplying and manufacturing packaging bag rolls for polypropylene product, with a list of previous clients attached.
2- The supplier must own a factory in Kuwait or in Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> countries for manufacturing packaging bag rolls for polypropylene product. A commercial registration certificate must be attached.
3- The factory's production capacity for packaging bags must not be less than 700 tons per year. A certificate to that effect must be attached.
4- The factory must include quality laboratories for measuring product specifications.
5- No penalties, sanctions, or violations must have been previously applied against the supplier by the Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC) <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>.
6- The supplier must have their own means of transportation to supply the product to the polypropylene plant.
7- The supplier must provide a sample of packaging bag rolls weighing 100 kg that complies with the specifications determined by the Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC) <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig> for testing 12 days before the closing date. The sample must be delivered to the polypropylene plant in Shuaikh Industrial Area <orig>المنطقة الصناعية الشويخ</orig> through the gate of Equate Petrochemical Company <orig>شركة إيكويت للبتروكيماويات</orig>. The supplier will receive a receipt from the Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC) <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig> and must submit this receipt with the bid form.
8- The supplier's checklist of requirements attached with the tender documents must be completed.

Gusseted Tube bag film Requirements
1- The Supplier shall have experience in manufacturing and
delivering of Gusseted Tube FFS bag film for Polypropylene product.
Customer reference list to be attached.
2- The Supplier shall have a plant (Factory) for Gusseted Tube bag
Film manufacturing in Kuwait or Gulf Cooperation Council Member
Countries GCC only. The Supplier must provide the “Commercial
Registration Certificate”.
3- The Plant (factory) has a production capacity of more than 700
metric ton/year of Gusseted Tube FFS bag Film. The Supplier must
provide the Plant designed capacity data sheet.
4- The Factory shall have Quality laboratories for product quality
analysis.
5- No penalties or violations have previously been applied against
the Supplier by the Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC).
6- Supplier shall have his own means of transportation to supply the
product to Polypropylene plant.
7- The Supplier shall provide a sample of 100 kg of Gusseted Tube
bag film roll that fulfilling Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC)
Specification's sheet before 12 days from tender closing date for
testing it. The sample to be handed in Polypropylene plant in Shuaiba
Industrial Area through Equate Petrochemical Company gate.
Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC) shall submit a receipt to the
Supplier and the Supplier shall submit this receipt with his bid.
8- Supplier shall fill the check list of Gusseted Tube bag film
Requirements that attached with tender documents.

Name: Supervision of Contract Works (H.T. / 273) <orig>هـ ط / 273</orig>
**Detailed Objectives:**
*   Development of 3 Industrial Kabad Link <orig>وصلة كبد الصناعية</orig> and parts of Industrial Kabad Road (604) <orig>طريق كبد الصناعية (604)</orig> and parts of the Sixth and Seventh Ring Expressways.
*   Alleviating traffic congestion, improving traffic safety, and meeting future traffic demands.
*   Increasing traffic flow and reducing traffic bottlenecks, which leads to a decrease in pollutant emissions and an improvement in air quality.
**Scope of Work:**
*   The project includes the development of Industrial Kabad Road <orig>طريق كبد الصناعية</orig> between the Sixth Ring Road <orig>الطريق الدائري السادس</orig> to the water filling station south, and includes the following developments:
    *   Development of 2 ramp roads to accommodate traffic flow in the northbound direction on Industrial Kabad Road <orig>طريق كبد الصناعية</orig> to the Seventh Ring Road <orig>الطريق الدائري السابع</orig>.
    *   Development of the intersection into a free-flow interchange at the extension of the Sixth Ring Road <orig>الطريق الدائري السادس</orig> and Industrial Kabad Link Road <orig>وصلة كبد الصناعية</orig>. This interchange will be developed by connecting Industrial Kabad Link Road <orig>وصلة كبد الصناعية</orig> with Industrial Kabad Road (604) <orig>طريق كبد الصناعية (604)</orig> by providing an underpass beneath the Sixth Ring Road <orig>الطريق الدائري السادس</orig>.
**Execution Period:** 27 months
**Expected Announcement Date:** 2025/10/1
**Required:** Public Tender
**Contracting Method:** Public Tender

### 4. Name: Construction, Completion, and Maintenance of Roads and Services for (4) Intersections on King Fahd Road <orig>طريق الملك فهد</orig> (Road 40) and a Pedestrian Bridge on Fahd Al-Salem Street <orig>شارع فهد السالم</orig>.
**Detailed Objectives:**
*   Improving the level of service on roads.
*   Improving traffic flow during peak hours.
*   Improving traffic safety.
**Scope of Work:**
*   The Fahd Al-Salem <orig>فهد السالم</orig> project consists of studying, designing, and supervising intersections in various locations, specifically including:
    *   Improving Road 40 along King Fahd Expressway <orig>طريق الملك فهد السريع</orig> where the need arose at four locations.
    *   Solving the problem of frequent pedestrian crossings during peak hours that obstruct the main street in Fahd Al-Salem <orig>فهد السالم</orig> near Al-Jahra Roundabout <orig>دوار الجهراء</orig> in Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig>.
**Execution Period:** 36 months

**Required:** Public Tender
**Contracting Method:** Public Tender

### 17
*   **الرقم (Ref. No.):** H.T. / 332
*   **مدة التنفيذ (Duration):** 8 months
*   **تاريخ الإعلان المتوقع (Expected Announcement Date):** 2025/12/1
*   **الاسم (Name):** Supervision of the construction, completion, and maintenance of works related to protection from stagnant rainwater floods for existing and future scattered areas in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>
*   **الأهداف التفصيلية (Detailed Objectives):**
    *   Maintaining the condition of roads, facilities, infrastructure, and public utilities in the mentioned areas, which will bring economic benefit to the State.
    *   Purchasing building materials locally leads to increased opportunities for trade, buying and selling, and raw material circulation. During normal construction phases, the effects are positive, direct, spatially specific, and short-term, with significant overall importance for the economy and employment.
    *   The operation of the project will lead to indirect economic gains by reducing maintenance costs for the State's roads and public utilities due to their protection from flood effects, and it will also extend the design life of these facilities.
    *   Protecting the environment by preventing the accumulation of rainwater, whether within the area or in surrounding areas where water might collect due to the absence of an integrated and safe rainwater drainage network.
*   **نطاق الأعمال (Scope of Work):**
    *   The project is located in existing and future urban development areas, which are distributed across various lands of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and cover the northern, southern, and western regions. This project aims to implement permanent protection for these areas from flood hazards, to avoid the repercussions and damages resulting from floods coming from outside these areas, through a set of radical solutions that will absorb flows before they reach these cities. These solutions include the implementation of permanent excavations according to environmental standards, a series of dams and water channels to divert floodwaters away from these cities, in addition to excavations for draining the surplus of the rainwater network for Al-Mutlaa <orig>المطلاع</orig> Residential City.
*   **أسلوب التعاقد (Contracting Method):**
    *   **المطلوب (Required):** Public Tender

# National Leasing and Finance Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الوطنية للإجارة والتمويل ش. م. ك. (مقفلة)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> of the shareholders of National Leasing and Finance Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الوطنية للإجارة والتمويل ش. م. ك. (مقفلة)</orig> held its extraordinary meeting at 12:00 PM on Wednesday, 23/4/2025, at the company's headquarters in Al-Mirqab <orig>المرقاب</orig> – Block 3, Omar Bin Al-Khattab Street <orig>شارع عمر بن الخطاب</orig> – K.B.T Tower <orig>برج K.B.T</orig> – 25th Floor – Meeting Room, with the attendance of:

*   Mr. / Salem Khader Mohammed Al-Hassawi <orig>سالم خضر محمد الحساوي</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors
*   Shareholders holding shares in person and by proxy, representing 87.23% of the total share capital of the company, which amounts to 416,084,680 shares.

After the announcement of the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> meeting, Mr. / Salem Khader Al-Hassawi <orig>سالم خضر الحساوي</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors – opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. He then proceeded to present the item on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> for discussion. The following was approved and endorsed by the attending shareholders:

**Item One:** Approval was granted to amend Article No. (15) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> and its amendments.

### Text Before Amendment:

The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> composed of (5) five members, from whom the entity or entities authorized to second representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall appoint members in proportion to their shareholding in the company, and the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall elect the remaining members by secret ballot.

### Text After Amendment:

The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> composed of (5) five members, from whom the entity or entities authorized to second representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall appoint members in proportion to their shareholding in the company, and the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall elect the remaining members by secret ballot.
Provided that the Board includes one or more independent members <orig>الأعضاء المستقلين</orig> who meet the conditions required by the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and possess qualifications, experience, and skills commensurate with the company's activity. These members shall be chosen by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, and their remuneration shall be determined according to governance rules <orig>قواعد الحوكمة</orig>, provided that their number does not exceed half of the Board members and is not less than 20% of the total number of Board members. It is not required for an independent member <orig>العضو المستقل</orig> to be a shareholder in the company, and it should be noted that the term of membership for an independent member <orig>العضو المستقل</orig> ends with the conclusion of the Board's term for which they were selected.

*   The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> meeting concluded at 12:30 PM on the same day. Mr. / Salem Khader Al-Hassawi <orig>سالم خضر الحساوي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, thanked the attending shareholders and extended his best wishes for the company's progress and prosperity.

Chairman of the Board of Directors

# The Commercial Real Estate Company (K.P.S.C.) <orig>شركة التجارة العقارية (ش.م.ك.ع.)</orig>
## Minutes of the Annual Extra-Ordinary General Assembly Meeting
### For the Financial Year Ended December 31, 2024

The Extra-Ordinary General Assembly Meeting of The Commercial Real Estate Company (K.P.S.C.) <orig>الشركة التجارية العقارية (ش.م.ك.ع.)</orig> was held on Monday, April 21, 2025, at 11:35 AM, immediately after the Ordinary General Assembly Meeting. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Abdulfatah Mohamed Rafie Marafie <orig>عبد الفتاح محمد رفيع معرفي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, and was held at the headquarters of The Commercial Real Estate Company <orig>الشركة التجارية العقارية</orig> - Sharq, Jaber Al Mubarak Street <orig>شارع جابر المبارك</orig> - Meeting Room, Second Floor, both physically and electronically, based on the invitation announced in local newspapers and the company's website, the notification letter issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, and the disclosures from Boursa Kuwait <orig>بورصة الكويت</orig> and the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>.

**The following participated in the meeting:**
1.  The Commercial Real Estate Company <orig>الشركة التجارية العقارية</orig>: Mr. Fouad Hassan Darwish <orig>فؤاد حسن درويش</orig> - Accounting Department Manager
2.  Representative of the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig>: Sheikh Marwan Abdulrahman Abu Taleb <orig>مروان عبدالرحمن أبوطالب</orig>
3.  Representative of the External Auditor: Mr. Bader Abdullah Al Wazzan <orig>بدر عبد الله الوزان</orig> - Deloitte & Touche - Al-Wazzan & Co.
4.  Representative of the Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>: Mr. Mohammed Bo Hadi <orig>محمد بو هادي</orig>

**Legal Quorum:**
The Chairman of the Board of Directors (Chairman of the Session) announced to the esteemed shareholders the availability of the necessary legal quorum for the valid convening of the Company's Extra-Ordinary General Assembly, based on the statement from the Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>. The attendance rate reached 65.853% of the total free shares and the company's capital, with 1,800,854,274 shares closed after excluding treasury shares, of which 39,845,477 shares were closed, equivalent to 2.16%, according to the statement (attendance and proxy / electronic).

Mr. / Chairman of the Session opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees and announcing the presence of shareholders owning 170,000,000 shares by proxy, representing 100% attendance of the company's total shares, and called for discussing the agenda items and approving the following:
*Approval was granted to amend Article (5) of the Articles of Incorporation and Article (4) of the Articles of Association regarding the company's objectives.
Text Before Amendment:
1- Ownership, sale, and purchase of real estate and lands, and their development for the company's account inside and outside the State of Kuwait, as well as managing third-party properties, all in compliance with the provisions stipulated in existing laws and what they prohibit regarding trading in private residential plots as stipulated by these laws.
2- Ownership, sale, and purchase of shares and bonds of real estate companies solely for the company's account in Kuwait and abroad.
3- Preparation of studies and provision of consultations in all types of real estate fields, provided that the required conditions are met by those who provide this service.
4- Carrying out maintenance work related to buildings and properties owned by the company and by others, including maintenance work, and executing civil, mechanical, electrical, and elevator works, and air conditioning works, to ensure the preservation and safety of buildings.
5- Organizing real estate exhibitions for the company's real estate projects, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>.
6- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
7- Direct contribution to establishing the infrastructure for residential, commercial, and industrial areas and projects under the "Build, Operate, Transfer" (BOT) system, and managing real estate facilities under the (BOT) system.
8- Ownership and management of hotels, health clubs, and tourist facilities, and their leasing and renting.
9- Management, operation, investment, leasing, and renting of hotels, clubs, motels, guesthouses, rest houses, parks, gardens, exhibitions, restaurants, cafeterias, residential associations, tourist and health resorts, recreational and sports projects, and cases, at various grades and levels, including all original and auxiliary services, attached facilities, and other necessary services.
10- Holding real estate auctions in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>.
11- Ownership and management of commercial markets and residential associations.
The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad. It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.

### Text of the Article Before Amendment:
The purposes for which the Company was established are to establish and operate cinemas in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, to import, produce, distribute films of all types and sizes, to export, rent, and sell them to others, to import all machinery and equipment necessary for the cinema industry, to trade in them, in raw films, photographic equipment, display equipment, and furniture, comprehensively including everything that may be incorporated into or used for the cinema industry, as well as to participate in all governmental or private tenders that fall within its objectives. It also has the right to agree with theatrical, musical, and entertainment troupes inside or outside Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> to organize events, provided that their presence does not conflict with the country's laws and regulations. The Company has the right to rent cinemas to governmental and private entities and to event organizers. In general, the Company specializes in everything related to cinema and its accessories, including aspects of culture, entertainment, and intellectual activity in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> and abroad.
The Company may also establish, operate, exploit, and import all necessary machinery, equipment, and devices for theatrical exhibition activities. It may exploit and rent commercial shops, restaurants, cafes, and entertainment arcades within cinema and theater buildings. It may manage and operate media, visual, and audio means, and undertake publishing, distribution, and media activities. The Company may carry out its purposes directly, or by trading with others, or by agency on behalf of others. It may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its purposes, and it may establish, participate in, or affiliate with such entities. The Company shall carry out all its purposes inside and outside Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>.

### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Eradat International Real Estate Company <orig>شركة إيرادات الدولية العقارية</orig> was held at 12:20 PM on Thursday, 2025/04/17, at the headquarters of Eradat International Real Estate Company <orig>شركة إيرادات الدولية العقارية</orig>, with the attendance of:
1. Shareholders representing 993,629,131 shares out of the company's total shares of 131,630,000 shares, thus the attendance rate was 99.99%.

**Text before amendment:**
The purposes for which the company was established are:
1. Owning, buying, selling, and developing real estate and land for the company's account inside and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, as well as managing third-party properties, all in compliance with the provisions stipulated in existing laws and what they prohibit regarding trading in private residential plots <orig>قسائم السكن الخاص</orig> as stipulated by the laws.
2. Owning, buying, and selling shares and bonds of real estate companies for the company's account only in Kuwait and abroad.

The Chairman of the session welcomed the esteemed shareholders present and requested to begin presenting and discussing the items on the agenda and voting on them.

**First: Reappointment of a Liquidator for the Company:**

The esteemed shareholders present unanimously approved, with a 100% vote, the reappointment of Mr. Hussein Abdullah Ahmed Jawhar <orig>حسين عبدالله أحمد جوهر</orig> as a voluntary liquidator for Dana Al-Khor Real Estate Company <orig>شركة دانة الخور العقارية</orig> (K.S.C.C. (under liquidation)). He is granted all powers in this regard in accordance with the provisions of the laws in force in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.

**Second: Determination of the Liquidation Period:**

The esteemed shareholders present unanimously approved, with a 100% vote, the extension of the liquidation period for one year to complete the liquidation work from the date of endorsement in the company's commercial register, due to pending cases that have not yet been decided as of this date, including the following:
1. Lawsuit No. 2022/8369 Commercial Plenary 45, appealed by cassation, and no hearing date has been set to date.
2. Lawsuit No. 2023/654 Commercial Plenary 23, appealed by cassation, and no hearing date has been set to date.

The liquidation fees were set at KWD 750 <orig>750 د.ك</orig> for the upcoming liquidation period.

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting (Adjourned)
The Extraordinary General Assembly (Adjourned) of the shareholders of Al-Sour Fuel Marketing Company <orig>شركة السور لتسويق الوقود</orig> (K.S.C.P.) held its meeting at the company's main headquarters located in Al-Mirqab <orig>المرقاب</orig> – Omar Bin Al-Khattab Street <orig>شارع عمر بن الخطاب</orig> – Kuwait Business City Tower <orig>برج مدينة الأعمال الكويتية</orig> – 25th Floor, at 12:00 PM on Sunday, 27/4/2025, with the attendance of:
*   Mr. Tareef Mohammed Baqer Al-Awadhi <orig>طريف محمد باقر العوضي</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors
*   Mr. Talal Ahmed Al-Khars <orig>طلال أحمد الخرس</orig> – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer.
*   Mr. Omar Khalil Ahmed <orig>عمر خليل أحمد</orig> – Representative of Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>.
*   Shareholders representing: 292,563,933 shares, constituting 72.311% of the company's total capital shares of 404,707,580 shares, through direct attendance in addition to attendance via the electronic system for participation in general assemblies specific to Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>.
After the announcement of the completion of the legal quorum for holding the meeting, Mr. Tareef Mohammed Baqer Al-Awadhi <orig>طريف محمد باقر العوضي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, opened the session, and the Extraordinary General Assembly commenced its work by discussing the agenda. The Assembly, with the shares represented at the meeting, approved the following:
1- Approval was granted for the increase of the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 40,470,758.000 (only forty million, four hundred seventy thousand, seven hundred fifty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) to KWD 42,089,588.300 (only forty-two million, eighty-nine thousand, five hundred eighty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 300 fils only), with an increase of KWD 1,618,830.300 (only one million, six hundred eighteen thousand, three hundred thirty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 300 fils only), through free bonus shares equivalent to 16,188,303 (only sixteen million, one hundred eighty-eight thousand, three hundred three shares) with a nominal value of 100 Kuwaiti fils <orig>فلس كويتي</orig> per share, which will be distributed to shareholders registered in the company's records on the entitlement date at a percentage of 4% of the company's total capital, at a rate of 4 shares for every 100 shares, and authorizing the Board of Directors to implement this decision and dispose of fractional shares, if any.
2- Approval was granted for the amendment of Article No. (7) of the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (6) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to become as follows:
Text of the two articles before amendment:
"The company's capital is set at KWD 40,470,758.000 (only forty million, four hundred seventy thousand, seven hundred fifty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), distributed over 404,707,580 shares (only four hundred four million, seven hundred seven thousand, five hundred eighty shares), with a value of 100 fils <orig>فلس</orig> (one hundred fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares."
Text of the two articles after amendment:
"The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at KWD 42,089,588.300 (only forty-two million, eighty-nine thousand, five hundred eighty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 300 fils only), distributed over 420,895,883 shares (only four hundred twenty million, eight hundred ninety-five thousand, eight hundred eighty-three shares), with a value of 100 fils <orig>فلس</orig> (one hundred fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares."

(Text after amendment) –
Net profits shall be distributed as follows:
Firstly: (10%) shall be deducted and allocated to the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> account. The General Assembly may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.
Secondly: (5%) of the net profits shall be deducted for the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>, as per the decree dated 12/12/1976.
Thirdly: Another percentage, proposed by the Board of Directors and approved annually by the General Assembly, shall be deducted and allocated to the voluntary reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الاختياري</orig> account. This deduction shall cease by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on the Board of Directors' proposals.
Fourthly: A portion of the profits shall be deducted, based on the Board of Directors' proposal and the General Assembly's report, to meet the company's obligations under labor laws. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
Fifthly: Subject to the provisions contained in the company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>, the Ordinary General Assembly may, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the financial year or the end of each financial period. The validity of this distribution requires that it be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that this distribution does not affect the company's paid-up capital.
Sixthly: After the foregoing, an amount approved by the Ordinary General Assembly, not exceeding (10%) of the remainder, shall be deducted and allocated as remuneration for the Board of Directors.
Seventhly: The remaining profits shall then be distributed to shareholders as an additional share in profits, or carried forward to the next year based on the Board of Directors' proposal, or allocated to establish an extraordinary reserve fund or depreciation fund.
3) Third item on the agenda:
Amendment of Article (5) of the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (4) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> and amendment of codes from local codes to international codes for the purposes for which the company was established.

(Text before amendment)
The purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Receiving and re-broadcasting satellite channels to subscribers in exchange for a periodic subscription.
2- Importing, exporting, and trading in equipment and devices necessary for the company's purposes.
3- Establishing buildings and maintenance workshops necessary for the company's purposes.
4- Advertising and publicity within the scope of the company's activity, represented by re-broadcasting satellite channels.
5- The company shall conduct the aforementioned activities within Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> only.
6- Establishing and implementing the necessary infrastructure for the company's purposes.
7- Establishing and managing studios for artistic production.
8- Wireless devices and systems, their installation and maintenance.
9- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized entities and companies.
The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that conduct similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> or abroad. It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.
(Text after amendment)
1- Project Management (821110)
2- Wireless devices and systems, their installation and maintenance (465998)
3- Investing financial surpluses in financial portfolios by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities (649918)

### 3- The amendment of Article (16) of the Company's Articles of Association has been approved to read as follows:

## Text of the Article Before Amendment:

The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (9) nine members, of whom the entity or entities entitled to appoint members pursuant to Decree-Law No. 25 of 2012 <orig>المرسوم بقانون رقم 25 لسنة 2012</orig> shall appoint a number proportionate to their ownership in the capital, and the remaining members shall be elected by secret ballot.

## Text of the Article After Amendment:

The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (9) nine members, of whom the entity or entities entitled to appoint members pursuant to Decree-Law No. 25 of 2012 <orig>المرسوم بقانون رقم 25 لسنة 2012</orig> shall appoint a number proportionate to their ownership in the capital, and the remaining members shall be elected by secret ballot, provided that the majority of the board members are non-executive, and at least 20% of the board members shall be independent members who meet the conditions required by the regulatory authorities and possess qualifications, experience, and skills commensurate with the company's activity. They shall be chosen by the Ordinary General Assembly, and their remuneration shall be determined according to governance rules. It is not required for an independent member to be among the company's shareholders. In case of a fraction in the calculation of the percentage, the result shall be rounded up to the next whole number, taking into account that the term of membership for an independent member ends with the expiry of the board's term for which they were chosen. The term of membership is three years, renewable. If it is not possible to elect a new board of directors by the specified date, the existing board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new board of directors is elected. The meeting concluded at 12:30 PM, and Mr. Tareef Al-Awadhi <orig>طريف العوضي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chairman of the Session, thanked the attending shareholders.

## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee in its Session
### No. 2025/12 Held on 15/04/2025

After reviewing the submitted requests for amending data in birth and death records, the Committee unanimously decided to publish the following in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the Committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendments will be made in the birth and death records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

## Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> - Medical Supplies Control <orig>مراقبة اللوازم الطبية</orig>) announces the launch of the following tenders:

<table_caption>Ministry of Health Tenders for Medical Supplies</table_caption>
<table>
| Tender No. | Description | Fees | Closing Date |
|:---|:------|:-------|:---|
| 1 5DX002    | For all departments in health centers and hospitals | 75     | 10 days from the date of announcement and more |
| 2 5DAN52    | Transparent nasal septum connector, for all departments in health centers and hospitals | 75     | 10 days from the date of announcement and more |
| 3 5CA001    | Consumables for the Cardiac Catheterization Department, specifically Al-Farwaniya Hospital <orig>مستشفى الفروانية</orig> | 75     | 10 days from the date of announcement and more |
| 4 5CF002    | Dual-chamber pacemaker, specifically Al-Farwaniya Hospital <orig>مستشفى الفروانية</orig> – Cardiac Catheterization Department | 75     | 20 days from the date of announcement and more |
| 5 5CF003    | Consumables used in cardiac catheterization procedures for specific needs of Al-Farwaniya Hospital <orig>مستشفى الفروانية</orig> | 75     | 20 days from the date of announcement and more |
| 6 5CDP03    | Consumables for pediatric cardiac catheterization, specifically Al-Sadri Hospital <orig>مستشفى الصدري</orig> | 75     | 20 days from the date of announcement and more |
</table>

Bids shall be placed in the bid box at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig>, and bids must be valid for a period of (90 days) from the closing date.
Companies wishing to participate in the tender must meet the following conditions:
1- Local companies must be registered with the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> in the suppliers' register.
2- Local companies must specialize in the medical field and be certified by an accredited certificate from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
3- When submitting two offers, two booklets must be purchased with different receipts.
4- Attach a valid product registration certificate from the Department of Registration and Control of Medical Drugs <orig>إدارة التسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية الطبية</orig>, or proof of submission of the certificate, and a copy of the manufacturer's and material's registration in the suppliers' register at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> within the contents of the submitted bid (specific to drug control).
5- Provide samples of new materials, whether it is a new product requested for the first time or from a new manufacturer for the specification (drugs – medical supplies).

Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1737, Seventy-First Year
</header>
for M.M. an amount of K.D. 2,451,921.548 (Two million, four hundred fifty-one thousand, nine hundred twenty-one Kuwaiti Dinars and five hundred forty-eight Fils) as of 22/11/2021, in addition to expenses and interest from that date until full payment, provided that the sale takes place at the factory premises and in accordance with the procedures stipulated in Article (44) of the Commercial Law <orig>قانون التجارة</orig>. If this day is not sufficient to complete the sale, it will be completed on the following three days.

It is noted that the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> (the Authority) does not object to the transfer of the aforementioned industrial license and its associated benefits, including the right to the plots on which the factory is built, to the successful bidder, after they pay the Authority the financial amounts due to it for the said plot. Therefore, those wishing to purchase must inspect the factory with an inspection that negates ignorance (i.e., a thorough inspection) and attend at the time and place specified above. For more information, the Compulsory Execution Department <orig>قسم التنفيذ الجبري</orig> – Al-Ahmadi Governorate <orig>محافظة الأحمدي</orig> can be consulted during official working hours. And for clarification, we announce.

Head of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة تنفيذ</orig>, Al-Ahmadi Governorate <orig>محافظة الأحمدي</orig>

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction

The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale of the real estate described below by public auction on Monday, 2/6/2025 – Hall 48 – on the second floor of the Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل</orig> at 9:00 AM – in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 89/2023 Sales/1 <orig>بيوع/1</orig>

Filed by:
Obaid Sabir Shannat Al-Shammari <orig>عبيد صبير شنات الشمري</orig>.

Against:
1- Fatima Abdullah Ghadnan Al-Shammari <orig>فاطمة عبدالله غدنان الشمري</orig>.
2- The Assistant Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> for Real Estate Registration and Documentation Affairs, in his capacity.
3- The Director of Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, in his capacity.

Real Estate Description (according to the attached description certificate)

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction starts at the base price, and participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price, in which case the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not proceed in the following session, and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense, based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session, and no bid in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of the execution procedures amounting to K.D. 200, as well as legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance (i.e., a thorough inspection).
Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "if the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

The disputed property is a house located on an inner corner on Street No. 54, with 4 entrances, bordered by neighbors on two sides, externally clad with yellow mosaic, and has a setback used for car parking with a canopy from the bridge accommodating 4 cars, and a side parking space for one car.
