- On the roof, there is a large room with heaters (boilers), in addition to another room made of the bridge, used as a guard's room.
Mr. Expert of Knowledge <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> has taken the necessary notes in preparation for estimating the property's value.

The expert, air conditioning units.
The expert was unable to inspect the interior of the property subject of the lawsuit, as the expert knocked on the door multiple times and no one opened. The plaintiff stated that he does not reside in the plaintiff's property, but rather his two brothers Hussein <orig>حسين</orig> and Dhaher <orig>ظاهر</orig> reside in the property. The expert of knowledge <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> inspected the property subject of the dispute from the outside only and recorded his observations in preparation for estimating its base price.
The plaintiff stated that the property consists of a ground floor and a first floor. The ground floor consists of two rooms, a hall, a bathroom, and a kitchen. The first floor consists of four rooms, two bathrooms, and a balcony that has been converted into a kitchen. He also stated that the property has a Diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> with its bathroom on the ground floor.
Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction starts with a base price of 355,500 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> (three hundred fifty-five thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise, the bidding will be re-opened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be re-opened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no new bidder comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately re-opened at their expense based on the price at which it was concluded in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by the deposit of its full value will be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any decrease in the property's price.
Sixthly: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the transfer and property registration fees, execution expenses and procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Court Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Warning:
-1 This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
-2 The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of pronouncement of the judgment in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
-3 The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall be considered a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to issue a lease contract in their favor accordingly."

## First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.

- Property Document No. 2023/1197 located in Sabah Al-Salem <orig>صباح السالم</orig> area - Plot No. (202) - Block No. (13) - Southern part of Plan No. M/36871 - Area 125.300 m².
- Notes: Consists of ground floor + first floor + second floor + roof.
- There are building violations (adhesion) on the ground floor + first floor + second floor - and a report has been filed.

### *Inspection:

On 2023/9/24, we moved to the disputed property located in Sabah Al-Salem <orig>صباح السالم</orig> area, Block (13) - Street (2) - Avenue (6) - Plot No. (202) - House (40), with automated number (1993191), in the presence and guidance of the third defendant personally. Accompanied by Mr. Sa'ad Mubarak Al-Mutairi <orig>سعد مبارك المطيري</orig>, the expert from the administration, the inspection time was as follows:
The disputed property conforms in terms of general and specific specifications to ownership and inheritance document No. 1197 dated 2023/2/8, with an area of 125.300 m².
The disputed property is a house located on a single internal street, numbered (2) Avenue (6), bordered on three sides, with a frontage of 12.25m.
The property subject of the lawsuit is divided into (3) sections and contains (3) entrances, with each section having its own private entrance, detailed as follows:

### 1- Section One:

- Ground floor consists of a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> + bathroom and washbasins - storage room + separate external back kitchen with bathroom + hall + bathroom and washbasins + storage room + bedroom.
- First floor consists of a hall + master bedroom + bedroom + balcony.
- Second floor consists of a master bedroom - storage room + unfinished room.
The third defendant was requested to enable the expert to inspect the remaining parts of the property (Section Two and Three), and the components were verbally obtained from the third defendant.

### 2- Section Two:

- Ground floor consists of a hall + master bedroom + bedroom + bathroom + kitchen + maid's room.
- Second floor consists of a hall + master bedroom + bedroom + bathroom + kitchen + maid's room.
- Third floor is a roof with an unfinished room.

### 3- Section Three:

Consists of an apartment located on the first floor with a separate external entrance, comprising a hall + kitchen + bathroom + maid's room + master bedroom + living room.
The air conditioning of the disputed property consists of separate units.
The exterior cladding is beige mosaic stone.
The expert inspected the property, taking into account the modernity of the construction and finishes, in preparation for estimating the highest basic price of the property for its sale in a public auction, and submitting a report thereon. He also reviewed the case file and its documents.

## Second: Auction Terms:

First: The auction shall commence with a basic price of K.D. 234,000 (Two Hundred and Thirty-Four Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be resumed in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone in that session accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price, or the bidder proceeds in the same session based on this price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be resumed at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement shall be published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.

### Notice:

1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner resides in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

**Second: Auction Terms:**
First: The auction shall commence with a base price of K.D. 297,000 (Two Hundred and Ninety-Seven Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

**Notice:**
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

On 2022/6/22, we proceeded to Sabah Al-Ahmad Residential City <orig>مدينة صباح الأحمد السكنية</orig>, Block 1, Street 102, Plot 358, from Plan No. M/39117, automated dispute property number 21094886, to inspect the disputed property on site, in the presence and guidance of the defendant personally, and with the assistance of Mr. Sami Ali Al-Tawarwa <orig>سامي علي الطواروة</orig>, the expert appointed by the administration. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The disputed property is a house consisting of a ground floor, a first floor, and a quarter of a second floor, covered with beige Sigma coating, overlooking two streets (front and back), and has attached neighbors on both sides.
- The property has a front yard overlooking Street 102 with a garden, a guard's room with a bathroom, and a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> with facilities. There is a small back yard overlooking Street 107, and a small side yard.

Second: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall commence with a base price of KWD 300,000 (three hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them in the preceding session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

**Seventh:** This announcement is published in application of the law, and the persons directly conducting the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.

**Eighth:** The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.

**Notice:**
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Firstly: The auction shall commence with a base price of KWD 369,000 <orig>369,000 د.ك</orig> (Three Hundred and Sixty-Nine Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was initially awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, calculated by depositing the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance (i.e., a thorough inspection).

### Article (7)
The Company's financial year begins on the first of January and ends on the last of December each year. An exception is made for the first financial year, which begins from the date of the Company's registration in the Commercial Register and ends in December of the following financial year.
(Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig>)

### Article (8)
(If the Company conducts its activities in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>, it must implement its actions in accordance with Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig> provisions. The Company must form an independent body called the (Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig>), consisting of a number of specialists in the principles of Islamic jurisprudence <orig>أصول الفقه الإسلامي</orig> who hold at least a university degree in this field, and their number shall not be less than three, appointed by the Company's General Assembly. Its responsibilities shall be as follows:
a) Providing Islamic Sharia <orig>الشرعي الإسلامي</orig> opinions on the Company's activities and actions.
b) Verifying the Company's compliance with Sharia <orig>الشريعة</orig> provisions.
c) Submitting an annual report to the Company's General Assembly, including its opinion on the extent of conformity of the Company's operations, activities, and actions with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>, and the extent of the Company's management's commitment to adhering to the opinions expressed by the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> in this regard, and any observations it may have on the Company's operations. This report shall be included in the Company's annual report. Opinions shall be taken by majority, and in the event that a majority cannot be achieved and there is a disagreement among the members of the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> regarding a Sharia <orig>الشرعي</orig> ruling, the matter shall be referred to the Fatwa Authority <orig>هيئة الفتوى</orig> in the Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs / Wizarat Al-Awqaf wal-Shu'un Al-Islamiyya <orig>وزارة الأوقاف والشئون الإسلامية</orig>.

### Article (6)
The company's shares are nominal and may be owned by non-Kuwaitis in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial decisions regulating thereof.

### Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine the date of its implementation. However, by a decision of the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, the issued capital may be increased within the limits of the authorized capital, provided that the issued capital has been fully paid.
New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value.

### Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the company's authorized capital may be increased by a decision issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> after the approval of the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and a report from the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> in this regard, provided that the decision to increase the capital includes the amount and methods of the increase.

### Article (9)
The company's capital is set at 10,000,000 KD – ten million Kuwaiti Dinars only.

If it is decided to increase the company's capital and some shareholders do not exercise their pre-emptive right <orig>حق أولوية الاكتتاب</orig> to subscribe to the capital increase shares, the unsubscribed shares shall be allocated to those company shareholders who wish to subscribe. If the subscription requests exceed the number of shares offered, they shall be allocated to the subscribers in proportion to their subscription. In all cases where the new shares are not fully subscribed, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders, and the unsubscribed new shares shall be deemed cancelled by operation of law.

### Article (10)
The company may increase its capital through public subscription <orig>الاكتتاب العام</orig> as stipulated in Article (160) of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations <orig>لائحته التنفيذية</orig>.

### Article (11)
(Optional text)
The shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by one or both of the following restrictions:
- 1- Requiring a pre-emptive right <orig>حق أولوية</orig> for the company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.

2- Requiring the approval of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for the share purchaser.
Dispositions referred to in Article (172) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> are excluded from these two restrictions.
(This text does not apply to companies listed on the stock exchange <orig>البورصة</orig>).

### Article (12)
(Mandatory text if the first restriction of Article 11 of these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> is adopted)
Before disposing of their shares, the shareholder must notify the company of the terms of sale. The disposition of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder submits a request to purchase the shares, this must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.

### Article (13)
(Mandatory text if the first restriction of Article 11 of these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> is adopted)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the company's purchase of its own shares, if the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> rejects the buyer, it must purchase the shares on behalf of the company within ten days from the date the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> is notified of the request for approval. In this case, the purchase shall be made at the price at which the shareholder agreed to sell their shares.

### Article (14)
Subscription

### Article (14)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> who signed the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the entire capital of the company with 10,000,000 shares (ten million shares), each with a nominal value of 0.100 fils (one hundred fils), distributed among them according to their subscription ratio as stated in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>. One million Kuwaiti Dinars (1,000,000 KD) of the nominal value of the shares they subscribed to has been paid to Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig> as per the attached bank certificate dated 15/4/2025.
The remaining part of the share value shall be paid within a maximum period of five years from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and on the dates determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. If a shareholder delays in paying the amounts due on the shares on time, the company must, after fifteen days from the date of warning them, offer their shares for sale to the other shareholders. The company shall recover from the sale price of the shares, with priority over all creditors of the shareholder, the value of the unpaid installments, interest, and any expenses incurred by the company. The remainder shall be returned to the shareholder. If the sale price of the shares is insufficient, the company shall claim the remainder from the shareholder's private assets.

### Article (15)
Ownership of a share necessarily entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, the provisions of the company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, and the resolutions of its General Assemblies <orig>جمعياتها العامة</orig>.

### Article (16)
Each share grants its owner the right to an equal share, without discrimination, in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits.

### Article (17)
The company shall have a special register kept by a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig> in which the names of the shareholders, their nationalities, their domiciles, and
the number and type of shares owned by each of them, and the value paid for each share, shall be recorded.
Any changes to the recorded data shall be endorsed in the shareholders' register in accordance with the information received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig> to provide them with the data from this register.

### Article (18)
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>
Within three months from the date of subscription and before the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed, the payment of due installments by subscribers, the names and addresses of subscribers, and the number of

Article (19)
The founders must invite the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of completion of the subscription. If the period expires without the Assembly being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the said period, invite the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene.

Article (20)
The invitation to attend the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall include the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, and shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1- Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2- Announcement, and the announcement must be made twice, provided that the second announcement is made after a period of no less than seven days from the date of publication of the first announcement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3- Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4- Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening for its representative to attend.
The meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be chaired by the person elected by the Assembly for this purpose.

Article (21)
The meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by voters with the right to vote representing more than half of the subscribed shares. If this quorum is not met, the Assembly must be invited to a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of no less than seven days and no more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
A new invitation for the second meeting shall not be issued if its date was specified in the invitation to the first meeting. Decisions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

Article (22)
The founders shall submit to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information about all incorporation operations and the amounts spent, along with supporting documents. This report shall be placed in a location specified by the founders for review at least seven days before the Assembly meeting, and this shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting.

Article (23)
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1- Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and conformity with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's articles of association.
2- Approving the valuation of in-kind shares, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3- Electing the members of the first Board of Directors.
4- Appointing the auditor and determining their fees.
5- Appointing members of the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> (if the company conducts its activities in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>).
6- Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting, including the resolutions adopted, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
The first Board of Directors must publish the company's articles of association and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.

Rights and Obligations of Shareholders
A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
1- Receiving profits and obtaining any grants decided for distribution.
2- Participating in the company's management through membership in the Board of Directors and attending general assemblies and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3- Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, the company's financial statements for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the auditor's report.
4- Disposing of his owned shares and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5- Receiving a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after settling its debts.

Article (25)
A member of the company shall specifically be obligated to the following:
1- Paying the installments due on his owned shares upon their due dates and paying compensation for delay in payment.
2- Paying the expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments of his share value, and the company has the right to execute on the shares to recover its rights.
3- Implementing the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
4- Refraining from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and being obligated to compensate for damages arising from violating this.

Article (26)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> of Shareholders may not do the following:
1- Increasing financial contribution burdens or increasing the nominal share value.
2- Decreasing the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as specified in the company's articles of association.
3- Imposing new conditions, other than those mentioned in the articles of incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>, related to the shareholder's right to attend and vote in general assemblies.
These provisions may be deviated from with the written consent of all shareholders or by a unanimous vote involving all shareholders, and by completing the necessary procedures to amend the company's articles of association.

Article (27)
A - Board of Directors
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (6) members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board of Directors is elected.

Article (28)
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors by secret ballot. The company's articles of association may stipulate that no more than half of the members of the first Board of Directors shall be elected from among the company's founders.

Article (29)
The Board of Directors shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman and a Vice-Chairman. The Chairman of the Board of Directors shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other competencies specified in the articles of association. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors in the company's relations with third parties, and he must implement the Board's resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman shall act in place of the Chairman in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

Article (30)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer <orig>رئيساً تنفيذياً</orig> appointed by the Board of Directors from among its members or from others, entrusted with managing the company. The Board shall define his competencies and powers to sign on behalf of the company.

Article (31)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board.

Article (32)
Every shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to their shareholding. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of elected Board members. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining Board members except to the extent exceeding the proportion used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members.
The shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

Article (33)
A meeting of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern communication methods, and decisions may be taken by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

Article (34)
Minutes of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary. Any member who did not approve a decision taken by the Board may record their objection in the meeting minutes.

Article (35)
If a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member's position becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the highest number of votes among those who did not win Board membership. If there is an impediment to that person, the next in line shall fill the position. The new member shall complete only the term of their predecessor. If the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must call a General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> of shareholders to convene within two months from the date of the last vacancy, and elect those who will fill the vacant positions.

Article (36)
A candidate for Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> membership must meet the following conditions:
1- Must possess legal capacity to act.
2- Must not have been previously convicted of a felony involving deprivation of liberty, a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, a crime against honor, or a penalty involving deprivation of liberty for violating legal provisions, unless their reputation has been restored.
3- Must personally own, or the person they represent must own, at least one (1) share of the company. If a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership shall cease.

Article (37)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be included in the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>. A person may be the chairman of the board of directors of more than one closed joint-stock company.

Article (38)
The Chairman or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain benefit for themselves or others.
A Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the Board, provided that it is
without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association, or these bylaws.

Article (39)
Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they became aware of due to their management. Otherwise, they shall be dismissed and held accountable for compensation resulting from the violation.

Article (40)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or any of its members may not combine membership in the board of directors of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company. Otherwise, the company may demand compensation from them or consider the operations they carried out for their own account as if they were conducted for the company's account, unless this is done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

Article (41)
The total remuneration of the Chairman and members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not exceed ten percent (10%) of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon).
An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and each member of this Board from the date of the company's establishment until profits are achieved that allow for the distribution of remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a resolution issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, an independent Board member may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration (if the company has independent members).
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is obligated to submit an annual report to the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> for approval, which must accurately include a detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages received by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, regardless of their nature or designation.

Article (42)
No person who has a representative on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or the Chairman, or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or a member of the executive management, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

Article (43)
The company may not lend to any of its Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, the Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig>, their spouses, or their relatives up to the second degree, or their affiliated companies, unless there is authorization from the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>. Any action taken in violation thereof shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of good faith third parties.
(This provision does not apply to companies authorized to lend.)

Article (44)
The Chairman and members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of power, any violation of the law or the company's articles of association, or errors in management. Without filing a liability lawsuit, a proposal from the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to discharge the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from liability is not permissible. Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members may not participate in voting on General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> resolutions related to discharging them from liability for their management, or those concerning a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or a dispute existing between them and the company.

Article (45)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability pertaining to a specific member, or joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable to pay compensation, except for those who objected to the decision that incurred the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

Article (46)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake to file the lawsuit.
<page_end>140</page_end>

<header>
101
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1737, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 6 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH – 4/5/2025 AD
</header>

## Article (47)
Every shareholder may file a liability lawsuit individually on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be made a party to the lawsuit so that it may be awarded compensation if warranted. A shareholder may file a personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them harm. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

## Article (48)
B – General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>
The annual ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within three months following the end of the financial year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may call the General Assembly to a meeting whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must issue an invitation for the General Assembly to meet based on a reasoned request from shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be determined by the inviting party. The provisions related to the founding assembly stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments shall apply to the procedures for calling the General Assembly, the quorum for attendance, and voting.

## Article (49)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote on their own behalf or on behalf of someone they represent in matters related to their personal interest, or in a dispute between them and the company. Any condition or decision that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may delegate another to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose. Anyone claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to issue an order on petition to deprive the disputed shares of voting for a period determined by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

## Article (50)
Voting for candidates for membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be subject to the cumulative voting system, which grants each shareholder voting power equal to the number of shares they own, entitling them to vote for one candidate or distribute their votes among the candidates without duplicating these votes.

## Article (51)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or their deputy, or someone delegated by the Board of Directors for that purpose, or someone elected by the General Assembly from among the shareholders or others.

## Article (52)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall, in its annual meetings, be competent to take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
- 1. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year.
- 2. The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
- 3. A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and penalties imposed on the company.
- 4. The company's financial statements.
- 5. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
- 6. Discharging the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
- 7. Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and determining their remuneration.
- 8. Appointing the company's auditor, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.

9. Appointing the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> (if the company operates in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>) and the report of that board.
10. Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties. Related parties are defined according to International Accounting Standards.

## Article (53)
By a resolution issued by the company's ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors may be dissolved and a new Board of Directors elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital.
When a resolution is issued to dissolve the Board of Directors, and amend the election of a new board at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either for the existing board to continue managing the company's affairs until the new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary administrative committee whose primary task shall be to call the General Assembly to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

## Article (54)
The ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes clear that the information related to some presented matters is insufficient, the meeting must be adjourned for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders owning one-quarter of the issued capital. The adjourned meeting shall convene without the need for new invitation procedures.

## Article (55)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of incorporation, or these regulations.
The Board of Directors must re-present the violating resolutions to the ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in a meeting called to discuss the aspects of the violation.

## Article (56)
The provisions related to the ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

## Article (57)
The extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning ten percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors must invite the extraordinary General Assembly to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors fails to invite the General Assembly within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

## Article (58)
The meeting of the extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met and a second meeting is called, it shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital, and resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

## Article (59)
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
- 1. Amending the company's articles of association.
- 2. Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other way.
- 3. Dissolving, merging, transforming, or splitting the company.
- 4. Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.
<page_end>141</page_end>

### Article (60)
Any resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly shall not be effective until the publication procedures have been completed.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

### Article (61)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit for the nullification of any resolution issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية أو غير العادية</orig> that violates the law, the company's articles of association, or these regulations, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation when necessary.
Resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية وغير العادية</orig> that prejudice the rights of the minority may also be challenged. Such challenges shall be made by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the issued capital, provided they did not approve those resolutions.

### Article (62)
(Company Accounts)
The company's financial year begins on the first of January and ends on the last of December of each year. The first financial year is an exception, starting from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ending in December of the following financial year.

### Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The Assembly may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage due to the absence of a statutory reserve that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits.
Any amount deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
Additionally, one percent (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> from the company's net profit.

### Article (64)
Annually, a percentage shall be deducted from the gross profits, determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase materials, machinery, and facilities necessary for their repair, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

### Article (65)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor laws and social insurance laws.
A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

### Article (66)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage not exceeding five percent of the net profits may be deducted to form a voluntary reserve allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.

### Article (67)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, may distribute dividends to shareholders at the end of the financial year, provided that for this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and must not affect the company's paid-up capital.

### Article (68)
Auditor
The provisions of Articles 227 to 233 of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments shall apply.

### Article (69)
At the end of each financial year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet and profit and loss statements for itself and all its subsidiaries, accompanied by explanations and data as required by International Accounting Standards.

### Article (70)
Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
The company shall be dissolved by one of the matters stipulated in Articles 266 to 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

### Article (71)
The liquidation of the company shall be carried out as specified in the provisions of Articles 278 to 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

### Article (72)
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not provided for in the articles of association or in these regulations.

### Article (73)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's head office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.

### Article (74)
The founders acknowledge the following:
First: That they have subscribed to all shares and deposited the amount required by law to be paid from their value in one of the local banks at the company's disposal.
Second: That the in-kind contributions have been valued in accordance with the provisions of the law and have been fully paid.
Third: That they have appointed the administrative bodies to manage the company.
Fourth: Preservation of the required papers and documents for the aforementioned declarations with the official editor.

### Article (75)
This contract was drawn up based on the letter from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> No. 2012202411834, registered with the Contracts and Companies Control Department <orig>مراقبة العقود والشركات</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> under automated number 6443875 on 27/4/2025.
First Party: Second Party: Third Party:
Fourth Party: Fifth Party:
- And as mentioned, this contract was drawn up and, after being read to those present, was executed.
Notary / Shaikha Yousef Al-Mass <orig>شيخه يوسف الماس</orig>

Technical Support and Preventive Maintenance for Fire Alarm and Fighting Systems at Kuwait International Airport <orig>مطار الكويت الدولي</orig> and Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> Facilities

Documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department – Tenders and Contracts Section at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> starting from (Sunday), corresponding to (2025/5/4), during official working hours, upon payment of (75 K.D.) (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), provided that payment is made via (k.net).
A preliminary meeting will be held at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> headquarters on (Monday), corresponding to (2025/5/12), at (11:00 AM), provided that the original purchase receipt is presented upon attendance, and only one person representing the company with a valid company residency permit may attend.
The documents, after being filled out and accompanied by the required supporting documents and an initial security deposit of no less than (2%) of the tender value, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, and not subject to any restriction or condition, shall be returned. Tenders not accompanied by this security will not be considered, even if they conform to specifications. The security must be valid for the required tender validity period. The documents shall be submitted in an official envelope sealed with red wax. Offers will be delivered to the (Tenders and Contracts Section) at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>.
Please note that the final deadline for submitting offers is (1:00 PM) on (Wednesday), corresponding to (2025/5/21). Any offer submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (161/2009) <orig>قرار البلدية رقم (2009/161)</orig> regarding the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee stipulated in Article One of this regulation may issue its decision to that effect after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- Fifteen (15) days have elapsed from the date of publishing this request in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the refund of the bank guarantee <orig>الكفالة المصرفية</orig> submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding building contracting agreements concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments <orig>حجوزات قضائية</orig> in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Department <orig>قسم المقاولين</orig> at the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.

Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

Regarding the request for approval to complete an economic concentration process

In accordance with Law No. (72) of 2020 concerning Competition Protection <orig>حماية المنافسة</orig> and Article (83) of its Executive Regulations issued by Resolution No. (14) of 2021 and its amendments, which stipulate that "any interested party may submit a reasoned objection to the Agency regarding the economic concentration request within a period not exceeding (15) fifteen days from the date of notification or publication."

Specialized merchants in this field are requested to refer to the Accounting Department (Cashier) at the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> in Mubarak Al-Abdullah <orig>مبارك العبد الله</orig> area, second floor, to obtain the specifications for a non-refundable fee of (150 K.D.) only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>, bringing with them the following documents:

8.  Submission of bids to the Tenders and Contracts Preparation Department at the General Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> in Mubarak Al-Abdullah <orig>مبارك العبد الله</orig> area (West Mishref <orig>غرب مشرف</orig>), first floor.

### Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>
Statement and Circular Regarding the Email Approved by the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> of Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> for all companies wishing to register with Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>.
Please be informed that due to an unknown party contacting local companies in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> using an unauthorized email address, tender@kuwaitairwaykw.com, and requesting them to register with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> of Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> via an email sent to them by that unauthorized party, for a financial consideration and fees involving large sums.
Therefore, the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> of Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> wishes to clarify to all companies that the approved email address for registration, communication, and receiving any documents related to registration with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> is the following approved Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> email address:
kwijtku@kuwaitairways.com
The Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> of Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> alerts all concerned parties to the necessity of exercising caution when communicating with unknown entities that impersonate an official capacity of the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> of Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> and request confidential data pertaining to companies dealing with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> of Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>. Accordingly, the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> of Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> confirms that the aforementioned email address is the approved email address for the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> of Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>, and anything else is not affiliated with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> of Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig>. Please note that registration with the Tenders and Auctions Committee <orig>لجنة المناقصات والمزايدات</orig> of Kuwait Airways <orig>الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> is free of charge and involves no financial fees.
This is for the information and awareness of all companies,,,
Committee Secretary
